channel.title: Mitb
channel.description: so if you hit the members button and then click on date registered, mitb wasnt the first to register but its his site 0.0 what happened there?

item.title: Mitb
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:6, topic:384008”]I changed my registration date to year 1, for lulz. But it will only let you go back as far as 1969, which has something to do with UNIX I think.

So when it was changed back to my real registration date, it set me for the begining of that day (12am)

Rix_ is right about uid’s being more accurate. Mitb’s was 1. I am 4. etc[/quote]

Yeah, basically the time is the start of the Epoch(Jan 1, 1970), and is a representation of the number of milliseconds since then.

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I changed my registration date to year 1, for lulz. But it will only let you go back as far as 1969, which has something to do with UNIX I think.

So when it was changed back to my real registration date, it set me for the begining of that day (12am)

Rix_ is right about uid’s being more accurate. Mitb’s was 1. I am 4. etc

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:4, topic:384008”]No jme’s time of registration was changed.

That memberlist, when sorted by time registered, obviously shows you… the time registered and admins can modify that. The member ID is determined when you register, and it isn’t editable.[/quote]
You can edit the member ID through the database with some serious nigger hacks.

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

No jme’s time of registration was changed.

That memberlist, when sorted by time registered, obviously shows you… the time registered and admins can modify that. The member ID is determined when you register, and it isn’t editable.

Read full topic
